subject: Re: one time setUp and tearDown

messageBody:
I've used it myself in the same context. I think it works well for testing
database applications, because loading the database can take a non-trivial
amount of time. The only problem I remember encountering is an occaisional
case of accidently updating the reference data in one of the tests. This of
course can cause downstream tests to fail. To combat this problem I try to
keep a well documented separation between tests which update the reference
data and those that do not. So basically it is more error prone, but the
performance gains often make up for it.

Mike Bresnahan
